mainEntity.name: What is Siemens Open Source Governance?

acceptedAnswer.text: Siemens Open Source Governance is an initiative that incorporates open source software to drive innovation across various business sectors while ensuring security and compliance. It includes a framework supported by the Open Source Program Office (OSPO) and cross-functional teams.

mainEntity.name: What are the key objectives of Siemens' open source governance?

acceptedAnswer.text: The key objectives of Siemens' open source governance include fostering innovation, ensuring compliance, promoting collaboration, and enhancing efficiency within its operations.

mainEntity.name: How does Siemens ensure compliance with open source usage?

acceptedAnswer.text: Siemens ensures compliance through stringent policies that govern OSS usage, license compliance, and security protocols. This includes automating compliance reviews and conducting regular security assessments.

mainEntity.name: How does Siemens participate in the open source community?

acceptedAnswer.text: Siemens actively participates in the open source community by contributing to OSS projects, establishing strategic partnerships, and engaging in industry conferences and events.

mainEntity.name: What future trends is Siemens focusing on within its open source strategy?

acceptedAnswer.text: Siemens is focusing on improving automation, enhancing global collaboration, fostering an open source culture, and adapting to emerging trends such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and blockchain.

mainEntity.name: Where can more information about Siemens' Open Source strategy be found?

acceptedAnswer.text: For more information about Siemens' Open Source strategy, you can explore their dedicated web pages on their Open Source Strategy and Open Source Governance at: [Siemens Open Source Strategy](https://www.siemens.com).
